message.content: hi claude! i'd like to go file by file and check the dotfiles before a big formatting session. the way i prefer to do this is via github issues so that is what this first session will be all about - setting up the github flow and plan

content.text: I'll help you set up a GitHub flow for systematically reviewing your dotfiles. Let me create a plan for organizing this review process through GitHub issues.

content.text: Now let me create an issue template for the review process:

input.content:
---
name: Dotfile Review
about: Template for reviewing individual dotfiles or directories
title: 'Review: [FILE/DIR NAME]'
labels: review:pending
assignees: ''
---

## File/Directory to Review
<!-- Path to the file or directory being reviewed -->
**Path:** `[PATH]`

## Review Checklist

### General
- [ ] Check for sensitive information (API keys, passwords, tokens)
- [ ] Remove unnecessary cache/temp files
- [ ] Verify file should be in version control
- [ ] Check for outdated/unused configurations

### Content Review
- [ ] Remove commented out old code (unless historically important)
- [ ] Verify all paths and references are correct
- [ ] Check for hardcoded values that should be variables
- [ ] Ensure consistency with other configurations

### Shell/Config Files
- [ ] Verify syntax correctness
- [ ] Check for deprecated commands/options
- [ ] Ensure compatibility with current tools/versions
- [ ] Remove duplicate configurations

### Directories
- [ ] Review each file in the directory
- [ ] Check `.gitignore` patterns are appropriate
- [ ] Remove build artifacts and generated files
- [ ] Verify directory structure makes sense

## Changes Made
<!-- List any changes made during the review -->
-

## Notes
<!-- Any additional notes, questions, or concerns -->


## Related Files
<!-- List any related files that might need coordinated changes -->
-

content.content: File created successfully at: /home/skogix/.dotfiles/.github/ISSUE_TEMPLATE/dotfile-review.md

content.text: Now let me create a script to generate all the review issues:

input.content:
#!/bin/bash
# Script to create GitHub issues for dotfile review

# Files and directories to review
declare -a items=(
    "aider.conf.yml:config"
    "basic-memory:directory"
    ".claude:directory"
    "CLAUDE.md:config"
    "config:directory"
    "envrc:shell"
    "gitconfig:config"
    ".github:directory"
    ".gitignore:config"
    "nvmrc:config"
    "rcrc:config"
    "README.md:config"
    "skogai:directory"
    "ZNT.md:config"
    "zsh-completions:directory"
    "zshenv:shell"
    "zshrc:shell"
    "zshrc2:shell"
)

echo "Creating GitHub issues for dotfile review..."
echo "Milestone: Dotfiles Review & Cleanup (#1)"
echo "========================================="

for item in "${items[@]}"; do
    # Split item into path and type
    IFS=':' read -r path type <<< "$item"

    # Determine labels based on type
    labels="review:pending,type:${type}"

    # Create title
    if [[ "$type" == "directory" ]]; then
        title="Review: ${path}/ directory"
    else
        title="Review: ${path}"
    fi

    # Create the issue body
    body="## File/Directory to Review
**Path:** \`${path}\`

## Review Checklist

### General
- [ ] Check for sensitive information (API keys, passwords, tokens)
- [ ] Remove unnecessary cache/temp files
- [ ] Verify file should be in version control
- [ ] Check for outdated/unused configurations"

    if [[ "$type" == "shell" ]]; then
        body="${body}

### Shell-specific
- [ ] Verify syntax correctness
- [ ] Check for deprecated commands/options
- [ ] Ensure compatibility with current tools/versions
- [ ] Remove duplicate configurations"
    elif [[ "$type" == "directory" ]]; then
        body="${body}

### Directory-specific
- [ ] Review each file in the directory
- [ ] Check \`.gitignore\` patterns are appropriate
- [ ] Remove build artifacts and generated files
- [ ] Verify directory structure makes sense"
    fi

    body="${body}

## Changes Made
<!-- List any changes made during the review -->
-

## Notes
<!-- Any additional notes, questions, or concerns -->
"

    # Create the issue
    echo "Creating issue: ${title}"
    gh issue create \
        --title "${title}" \
        --body "${body}" \
        --label "${labels}" \
        --milestone 1

    # Small delay to avoid rate limiting
    sleep 1
done

echo "========================================="
echo "All issues created successfully!"
echo ""
echo "View all issues: gh issue list --milestone 'Dotfiles Review & Cleanup'"
echo "View in browser: gh issue list --milestone 'Dotfiles Review & Cleanup' --web"

content.content: File created successfully at: /home/skogix/.dotfiles/scripts/create-review-issues.sh

done

For each of these files/directories, create an issue with title "Review: [name]" and appropriate labels:

content.text: Perfect! The milestone exists with ID 1. Now let me create the issues. I'll create them all with a bash script to be efficient:

input.command:
cat > /tmp/create_issues.sh << 'EOF'
#!/bin/bash

# Array of files/directories with their types
declare -A files=(
    ["aider.conf.yml"]="config"
    ["basic-memory/"]="directory"
    [".claude/"]="directory"
    ["CLAUDE.md"]="config"
    ["config/"]="directory"
    ["envrc"]="shell"
    ["gitconfig"]="config"
    [".github/"]="directory"
    [".gitignore"]="config"
    ["nvmrc"]="config"
    ["rcrc"]="config"
    ["README.md"]="config"
    ["skogai/"]="directory"
    ["ZNT.md"]="config"
    ["zsh-completions/"]="directory"
    ["zshenv"]="shell"
    ["zshrc"]="shell"
    ["zshrc2"]="shell"
)

# Create issues for each file
for file in "${!files[@]}"; do
    type="${files[$file]}"
    
    # Create the issue body
    body="## File/Directory to Review
**Path:** \`$file\`

## Review Checklist
- [ ] Check for sensitive information
- [ ] Remove unnecessary cache/temp files
- [ ] Verify file should be in version control
- [ ] Check for outdated/unused configurations"
    
    # Add shell-specific checklist item for shell files
    if [ "$type" = "shell" ]; then
        body="$body
- [ ] Review syntax and compatibility (for shell files)"
    fi
    
    # Add directory-specific checklist item for directories
    if [ "$type" = "directory" ]; then
        body="$body
- [ ] Check directory structure (for directories)"
    fi
    
    echo "Creating issue for: $file"
    
    gh issue create \
        --repo Skogix/.dotfiles \
        --title "Review: $file" \
        --body "$body" \
        --label "review:pending,type:$type" \
        --milestone 1
        
    if [ $? -eq 0 ]; then
        echo " Created issue for $file"
    else
        echo " Failed to create issue for $file"
    fi
    
    # Small delay to avoid rate limiting
    sleep 1
done

echo "All issues created!"
EOF

chmod +x /tmp/create_issues.sh

input.content:
# Dotfiles Review Checklist

## Files to Review

### Configuration Files
- [ ] aider.conf.yml
- [ ] CLAUDE.md
- [ ] gitconfig
- [ ] .gitignore
- [ ] nvmrc
- [ ] rcrc
- [ ] README.md
- [ ] ZNT.md

### Shell Files
- [ ] envrc
- [ ] zshenv
- [ ] zshrc
- [ ] zshrc2

### Directories
- [ ] basic-memory/
- [ ] .claude/
- [ ] config/
- [ ] .github/
- [ ] skogai/
- [ ] zsh-completions/

## Review Steps for Each File

1. Check for sensitive information (API keys, passwords, tokens)
2. Remove unnecessary cache/temp files
3. Verify file should be in version control
4. Check for outdated/unused configurations
5. Remove commented out old code (unless historically important)
6. Verify all paths and references are correct
7. Check for hardcoded values that should be variables
8. Ensure consistency with other configurations

## Additional Steps for Shell Files
- Verify syntax correctness
- Check for deprecated commands/options
- Ensure compatibility with current tools/versions
- Remove duplicate configurations

## Additional Steps for Directories
- Review each file in the directory
- Check .gitignore patterns are appropriate
- Remove build artifacts and generated files
- Verify directory structure makes sense
